dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Ten senior representatives from Kazakhstan's energy sector, including the heads of the Shymkent and Aktau refineries, are heading to this forum.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: All in all the delegation will consist of 15 senior representatives including the heads and managers from the Modernization and Perspective Projects Department of the Kazakhstans national oil company.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that's a huge delegation. And it's the sixth edition of this event, right? Partnering with Kazatomprom and the Ministry of Industry.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but it's not all smooth sailing—I mean, uh, did you see that KazMunayGas got delisted from the London Stock Exchange?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, due to poor performance. That's a pretty big deal. But they're still pushing forward with modernization, like that multi-billion dollar investment in the Pavlodar refinery.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And it's not just Kazakhstan—Azerbaijan and Tajikistan are big focuses this year too. Azerbaijan's pouring money into upstream, and Tajikistan just announced a new petrochemical plant with a Russian partner.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Uzbekistan's in the mix as well—Uzbekneftegaz has a 10.4 billion dollar program to boost refined exports through 2025.

dialogue_turns.text: Wow, so much happening. I wonder if they'll address the rumors about a potential new refinery in West Kazakhstan?

artist_script:
HostA: Ten senior representatives from Kazakhstan's energy sector, including the heads of the Shymkent and Aktau refineries, are heading to this forum.
HostB: Oh, that's a huge delegation. And it's the sixth edition of this event, right? Partnering with Kazatomprom and the Ministry of Industry.
HostA: Exactly. And it’s happening right before Kazakhstan Energy Week, which is a whole week long. They're really doubling down on these high-level meetings.
HostB: Yeah, but it’s not all smooth sailing—I mean, uh, did you see that KazMunayGas got delisted from the London Stock Exchange?
HostA: Right, due to poor performance. That’s a pretty big deal. But they're still pushing forward with modernization, like that multi-billion dollar investment in the Pavlodar refinery.
HostB: And it’s not just Kazakhstan—Azerbaijan and Tajikistan are big focuses this year too. Azerbaijan's pouring money into upstream, and Tajikistan just announced a new petrochemical plant with a Russian partner.
HostA: Uzbekistan's in the mix as well—Uzbekneftegaz has a 10.4 billion dollar program to boost refined exports through 2025.
HostB: Wow, so much happening. I wonder if they'll address the rumors about a potential new refinery in West Kazakhstan?
HostA: The text says no recent news on that, actually. But with all these projects, the region is clearly betting big on energy.
HostB: For sure. And hey, if any listeners want to attend, Forbes Kazakhstan readers get a 10% discount with promo code FORBES10.
HostA: Nice! The link's in the show notes if anyone's curious about the full agenda.
